|Title=Know the definition of encephalic death
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dany Anglicheau
|Order=6}}

Encephalic death is the definitive and irreversible destruction of the brain.

It corresponds to a deep, reactive coma, with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing.

properties.question: What defines encephalic death?
properties.option_a: The presence of minor brain function that can recover over time.
properties.option_b: A temporary coma from which a patient can potentially awaken.
properties.option_c: The irreversible destruction of the brain, including deep coma and absence of spontaneous breathing.
properties.option_d: The gradual loss of cognitive abilities due to aging.
